title: Question With No Meaningful Answer
question_text:
Robin asked $80$ children to identify their favorite season. The results are shown below.
$\text{Spring: }25\%$
$\text{Summer: }35\%$
$\text{Fall: }15\%$
$\text{Winter: }25\%$
Robin also asked $60$ adults to identify their favorite season. The results are shown below.
$\text{Spring: }40\%$
$\text{Summer: }20\%$
$\text{Fall: }30\%$
$\text{Winter: }10\%$
Which of the following questions cannot be answered in a meaningful way from Robin's sets of data?

choices.text: What is the average (mean) number of individuals who responded "Spring"?
What is the combined proportion of individuals who responded "Summer"?
What is the combined frequency of "Fall" as a response?
Among those surveyed, was "Winter" more popular among children or adults?
Among those surveyed, was favorite season the same for both children and adults?
